data.what_is: Camp is a simple Go to Market (GTM) platform that brings all routes to market together. The all-in-one platform helps organizations with multi-channel marketing automation, sales lead management, and partnerships.
data.product_description: Campaign Automation and AI-enabled marketing platform - Camp enables businesses to plan, automate, and analyze marketing campaigns and to measure effectiveness within and extended enterprise. Organizations can measure effectiveness across multiple campaigns, channels, locations & partner ecosystems.

initial_reviews.review_title: AD AGENCY-FRIENDLY, USER-FRIENDLY, CLIENT-FRIENDLY AUTOMATION SOFTWARE
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Camp Automation?
No need to deal with multiple providers or consultants such as a programmatic buying platform or a digital marketing agency. CAMP is a one-stop-shop. I have interacted with CAMP clients and have found their satisfaction levels very high. The monthly subscription module rather than a one-time fee, or annual fee makes the software affordable. Clients also have the option to disengage if they wish to.

What do you dislike about Camp Automation?
On the face of it, there are no minus points or segments of the software that a user can dislike. If you ask me, I dislike the CAMP team's humility. When they have such a powerful software, they should make it more visible among ad agencies and clients. Instead they go about their work with commitment and sincerity with the firm belief that hard work and a future-ready platform will get organic visibility in the long run.

Recommendations to others considering Camp Automation:
Try it once. You will be happy  with the choice.

What problems is Camp Automation solving and how is that benefiting you?
Omnichannel communication is the problem I have seen clients solve with CAMP. The benefits are higher ROI and low TCO. The productivity also takes a leap because we are able to launch integrated communication and thereby get the benefits.

initial_reviews.review_title: The field experience is seen in the offering
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Camp Automation?
The clean interface, consistency of UI and UX, and of course, the obvious practical field experience - these are solutions by marketing and sales professionals, not mere developers looking for a potential market.

What do you dislike about Camp Automation?
As a startup, I remain uncomfortable with the pricing during the ramp-up phase. While the cost is reasonable considering the "unlimited" plan, it can be expensive for a company like ours that may take months to reach a significant number.

What problems is Camp Automation solving and how is that benefiting you?
Nothing new: marketing automation, done well. The "done well" is what we liked about Camp Automation. We are still not actively using Camp, but have signed up to use it when our product is ready for prime-time.

initial_reviews.review_title: Easy to use multi-channel marketing automation for any marketing professional.
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Camp Automation?
Its very intuitive to use. It comes with unlimited contacts and emails, keeps the costs under control. One of the cool things is that we can do multiple channels in the same workflow - start with a facebook campaign - move to lead nurturing via emails - end in an sms or direct message on twitter!

What do you dislike about Camp Automation?
While it has the provision to create a new template from scratch easily, it has limited number of pre-built templates. Maybe they could build a master template with multiple provisions of content combinations.

Recommendations to others considering Camp Automation:
Talk to the Founder to understand how best to use this.

What problems is Camp Automation solving and how is that benefiting you?
Ability to automate always-on campaigns is quite useful. The key benefit is that most of the operational elements become smooth even when the marketing executives leave the organization.
